TopicTitle: [1.2.x] [1.4 in Development] Real KSC in KSP Dev Continued

Articles.Content:
I want the crawler for my Saturn rockets, looks pretty good.

Does the crawler use the launch clamp module so if we use ClampsBeGone it will disappear afterwards?

it has a built in decouple node on it. no clamps at all. you decouple when you launch and you fly away.

then you can go back to it later and drive it away. or blow it up, whatever.

> 
> then you can go back to it later and drive it away. or blow it up, whatever.

I just had to give this a bump ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Too funny

> 
> it has a built in decouple node on it. no clamps at all. you decouple when you launch and you fly away.
> then you can go back to it later and drive it away. or blow it up, whatever.

most likely blow up... just saying
so I'm making the launch tower for the CST-100/atlas V pad. heres how it looks so far ![0J0zeFI.gif](http://i.imgur.com/0J0zeFI.gif)

> 
> so I'm making the launch tower for the CST-100/atlas V pad. heres how it looks so far [http://i.imgur.com/0J0zeFI.gif](http://i.imgur.com/0J0zeFI.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

It's the CST-100 astronaut skywalk

that crawler mod is here: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/61cjj8maqn...ermod.zip?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/61cjj8maqndyttz/crawlermod.zip?dl=0)

 still wip obviously.

 the node floating on the Launchpad between the 2 launchclamps attaches to the spare node on the shuttle between the engines.

 please remember that.

 don't forget to stage it right

 also the wheels are not finished yet but will move you around slowly anyway. oh and the 'break' maybe because its hundreds of tons lol

 don't complain that this killed your kerbal or blew up your ksp head office or something

I am having a problem with the crawler, it gives me Kraken when I stage it.

I used clamps with it, is that the problem?

> 
> I am having a problem with the crawler, it gives me Kraken when I stage it.
> I used clamps with it, is that the problem?

Unless Mike has changed it, it should have a node you can attach the shuttle to. No need for clamps ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Btw if you have the gantry of mine installed already and you install my new one you wont need to do anything ingame. It will just update the 3d model basically

- - - Updated - - -

Nooo no clamps!

Use the floating node to attach the shuttle to the spare node on the shuttle between main engines.

Just apply handbrake when you leave the VAB. 

You can stack all sorts of extra decouplers and ships to the crawler if you want but dont put clamps on the ships. This will cause colliders to go through colliders

- - - Updated - - -

>

All good my man. Enjoy the mod and I will continue to improve it

Since you guys seem to be halfway there already, with a drive-able crawler and all, figured I'd share an idea I've had for a few months. How about re-modeling the LC39 VAB with an interior, and instead of (or in addition to) having a spawn point at the launch site, put the spawn point inside the VAB. Then have your crawler part that can attach to and drive the mobile launch pads around, and have various adapter parts for different configurations to attach to it. (Saturn V w/ Tower, Saturn 1B w/ Tower and Milkstool, Shuttle Clamps, SLS clamps with SLS Tower)

How about re-modeling the LC39 VAB with an interior, and instead of (or in addition to) having a spawn point at the launch site, put the spawn point inside the VAB. Then have your crawler part that can attach to and drive the mobile launch pads around, and have various adapter parts for the MLP for different configurations to attach to it. (Saturn V w/ Tower, Saturn 1B w/ Tower and Milkstool, Shuttle Clamps, SLS clamps with SLS Tower)

 That would be good..
